column1: On #NationalRuralHealthDay we thank all of our community-minded health heroes who -- despite the challenges presented by COVID-19 -- have been able to make a positive impact and selflessly serve our rural communities. https://t.co/is6Zoi4VMs
More great news as we work toward a safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine! Moderna is reporting that its experimental vaccine is 94.5% effective in preventing the coronavirus. https://t.co/iYPStQHlMN

Great news as we work to combat COVID-19! Thanks to President Trump’s leadership under Operation Warp Speed Pfizer HHS & the Military have formed a partnership to produce & deliver a safe effective vaccine following successful manufacture & approval. https://t.co/ELAun359Fg

I had the honor of visiting America Knits in Swainsboro. When COVID-19 first hit and PPE supplies were short they helped the Presidential Task Force make masks and gowns for our medical professionals. Thank you to the whole team for your service to our nation! https://t.co/zEWCZk4GAN

American businesses workers and families are waiting for vital COVID-19 relief but Democrat leadership refuses to work with Republicans and President Trump on a bipartisan deal. https://t.co/qzh32fXgyu

Congrats to @GovKemp for ranking 2nd in the Laffer-ALEC Report on COVID-19 response. Your leadership and our state savings allowed Georgia to provide relief to workers and businesses without raising taxes. Here’s the full report: https://t.co/QqI0yHOptR

Important read: Research finds minimal link between in-person instruction and COVID-19 cases. It’s more harmful to our students to keep schools closed and I’m proud of schools in #GA12 for finding ways to reopen safely. https://t.co/NEE2EUpSwQ

I stopped by the @boroherald to discuss my ongoing priorities in Congress. Our nation must defeat COVID-19 by developing a safe and effective vaccine focus on rebuilding the greatest economy in the world & ensure safe communities by supporting our police. https://t.co/arU9uWF4RL
Thanks to Treutlen and Wheeler County Schools for hosting me to see firsthand the protocols implemented to combat COVID-19 and to keep students teachers and staff safe. https://t.co/XcOmwwZh3X

As a small businessman it is an honor to receive @NFIB’s #smallbizguardian award for my strong pro-small business voting record. It’s been an especially tough year for small businesses and I will continue to fight to deliver vital COVID-19 relief to #GA12. https://t.co/TAl5y4Uza5
We are rebuilding the U.S. economy and September marked the fifth consecutive month of job gains following the outbreak of COVID-19. https://t.co/ys5kNe2qGJ

Unemployment has dropped below 8 percent for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic hit us in March. Though there’s more work ahead I have no doubt we will rebuild the greatest economy in the world. https://t.co/NYNtufRGsw

Today I spoke during debate on the House floor in opposition to Democrats’ Heroes Act 2.0 a socialist wish list with zero chance of becoming law that is full of liberal provisions completely unrelated to the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/Wb0yuBIKKU

Before COVID-19 Congressional Republicans & President Trump built the greatest economy in the world with historically low unemployment rates and millions of jobs added to U.S. payrolls. Our #CommitmentToAmerica is that we will do it again. https://t.co/HU73VL0DfY https://t.co/PmSqtQh47L
.@AUG_Health is now offering saliva testing as a simpler and noninvasive test for COVID-19 for children and will begin offering the test to adults on Sept. 28.

Any COVID-19 relief bill should include funding for #schoolchoice. It's been a tough year- families need flexibility in education and no student should be subject to falling behind academically because of their zip code or family resources. https://t.co/V2N2z6u6La
For more info on eligibility and how to apply for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program 2 visit https://t.co/h7iRnRzb6b

Beginning September 21@USDA will make an additional $14 billion available thanks to funding from the CARES Act for agricultural producers who continue to face market disruptions and associated costs because of COVID-19.

It was great visiting Statesboro High School today to learn how they have adapted to learning in the age of coronavirus. Thank you to the teachers and staff who are committed to ensuring students can succeed this school year. https://t.co/EIVkxjIDQ6

Despite challenges from COVID-19 Georgia’s economic momentum is strong! Just two months into the state’s new fiscal year and we’ve seen:  ✅  $642 million in new investments  ✅ 4062 jobs created https://t.co/XFDqgbspkT

For the 7th consecutive year Georgia has been named the Top State for Doing Business by Area Development. Before COVID-19 America had the strongest economy in the world & I have no doubt we will rebuild it again – and I’m proud of GA for leading the way. https://t.co/MrI4wS3dNt

Today I joined several of my @EdLaborGOP colleagues in sending a letter to @SecretarySonny asking @USDA to ensure the federal programs that help feed students are flexible easy to operate & free of unnecessary burdens during the coronavirus. Our letter➡️https://t.co/zU2HsCEgaB

Thanks to Dr. Robin Jackson Director of the Charlie Norwood VA for providing me with a COVID-19 update. During this unprecedented time our priority to veterans’ care remains steadfast. https://t.co/OXBQzmg9N7

The Great American Comeback is underway thanks to President Trump's leadership! Unemployment claims fell to less than 1 million last week for the first time since the coronavirus pandemic hit in March. https://t.co/oDpfQYGtc2

The only way to truly combat COVID-19 and prevent future outbreaks is to develop a safe and effective vaccine. Under the direction of President @realDonaldTrump this Administration has launched Operation Warp Speed which aims to develop a vaccine at record speed! https://t.co/z6xUDYqSqg

Another analysis conducted by McKinsey and Company a consulting group found that when all the impacts of COVID-19 are taken into account the average student could fall seven months behind academically. We must give the option to #ReopenSafely https://t.co/SGCiY1y6vK

This school year will look different than previous years due to the impact of COVID-19 but ultimately the decision regarding what type of learning environment will work best for each student should be made by the family. 2/3

Atlanta Mayor Bottoms should come to Augusta to see for herself the world-class work @AUG_University is doing to combat COVID-19. I’m so proud to have AU in #GA12 and am grateful to @GovKemp for utilizing their expertise during this critical time. https://t.co/KC9VToAjgl
Remember to wash your hands and #WearAMask when you’re out in public! Together Georgians can fight COVID-19. https://t.co/M7QIz0hXSW
The largest monthly jobs gain in the history of our country! The newest #JobsReport shattered expectations as we continue COVID-19 recovery with nearly 5 million jobs added. https://t.co/d1vIG2hNVd

Once again my colleagues across the aisle are using the COVID-19 crisis as an opportunity to push their partisan agenda. House Dems just passed legislation to expand Obamacare & implement government price setting for drugs. I opposed this power grab. https://t.co/jOK9q5FBTw

Thank you @RepGregWalden and @GrassleyPress for requesting an investigation into whether states violated federal guidance in pressuring nursing home facilities to accept patients who tested positive for COVID-19.  https://t.co/vQKU79LSZB

Robin and I had a great time helping at the Georgia Grown To Go event in Augusta today. This program supports our hard-working farmers while helping alleviate the impact COVID-19 placed on our supply chain. https://t.co/YAu84LS40P

- Experienced reductions in business activity as a result of health directives related to COVID-19 and did not reduce the salaries or wages of their employees by more than 25%.  The EZ forgiveness application can be accessed here: https://t.co/xPAndEMYGR

Fort Gordon recently welcomed Army Chief of Staff Gen. James C. McConville & provided him with an update on their response to COVID-19 as well as the future of the Fort. #GA12 is proud of Fort Gordon for their continued contribution to military readiness. https://t.co/lb96xIlP70

COVID-19 has demonstrated the need to bring back control of the U.S. supply chain. I had the opportunity to tour University Hospital Summerville and learn about the gown and anti-viral production lines they have set up because they cannot rely on foreign supply chains any longer. https://t.co/pZwU1UDzU9
It was great to join @SecretarySonny in Atlanta to see how this program is helping feed families impacted by COVID-19. https://t.co/kkrIugczQs

No eligible business like our lawful #2A industries should be excluded from participating in the COVID-19 economic relief programs passed by Congress. Proud to join @RepRichHudson & my colleagues urging Treasury Federal Reserve & SBA to prevent this unlawful discrimination. https://t.co/SVJDYx10u6

Starting today farmers whose operations have been impacted by COVID-19 can apply for direct financial relief through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. For more info on how to apply visit https://t.co/xEGoimbjGQ
CFAP will provide up to $16 billion in direct payments to deliver relief to farmers and ranchers impacted by COVID-19. https://t.co/SddlSvwrk0
.@SecretarySonny & @realDonaldTrump continue to support America’s farmers. Today @USDA announced details of the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP).

.@GovKemp and the Georgia Department of Economic Development today released a list and interactive map of over 220 Georgia companies that have signed up to help businesses obtain personal protective equipment and health care supplies to fight COVID-19.
President Trump and I are continuing to work together to combat the coronavirus and ensure Georgians are equipped with PPE. https://t.co/DM2clLZCZh

This week Congress will consider Speaker Pelosi and House Democrats' 1800-page bill that will cost more than $3 trillion. This attempt by Democrats to use COVID-19 as an opportunity to enact their agenda is an abuse of power. https://t.co/9LjOX7bcKU

Our nurses have faced the COVID-19 pandemic with courage and commitment serving as an inspiration to us all during this time. It is thanks to their hard work that we will beat this virus. Happy #NursesAppreciationWeek! https://t.co/SxCeG8OwkT

The Paycheck Protection Program is providing critical support to millions of small businesses and American workers. So far over 3800000 loans have been processed to help those in need of financial certainty during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/XiOY1RbB7v

Today Robin and I join @GovKemp for a Day of Prayer. In the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic we are lifting up our frontline healthcare workers first responders law enforcement business owners local leaders and all Georgians. Together we will defeat this disease.

Attention #GA12 small businesses impacted by the coronavirus outbreak: The Treasury Department will be issuing guidance for the Paycheck Protection Program tomorrow. Time will be of the essence as funding for this program is limited to $350 billion at this current time.

#GA12 small businesses: Georgia has received an official statewide disaster declaration from the U.S. Small Business Administration to provide assistance in the form of SBA Economic Injury Disaster Loans to impacted small businesses suffering related to the Coronavirus.

I will continue to monitor how the coronavirus outbreak is impacting #GA12 and provide updates. Please do not hesitate to contact my office if we can be of assistance during this time (visit https://t.co/jauFeuSXrG). Together we will get through this.

I had the opportunity to personally speak with small businesses in #GA12 today to give a brief update on efforts by the federal government to support small businesses that have incurred losses related the COVID-19 pandemic.

Today I held calls with the Georgia Hotel and Lodging Association and the Georgia Restaurant Association to hear how the coronavirus outbreak is impacting their industries.  They told me that their businesses across Georgia are facing difficult decisions in the days to come.

If you’re experiencing symptoms of COVID-19 or have been exposed please contact your primary care doctor an urgent care clinic or your local federally qualified healthcare center. Please do not show up unannounced at an emergency room. The GA Coronavirus Hotline: 844-442-2681
